title: Pacers' Tyrese Haliburton to make debut as player contributor with NBA on Prime
description: Pacers Tyrese Haliburton will make his NBA on Prime debut as a player contributor on Tuesday.
fullText:
Indiana Pacers fans don't have to wait until next season to see Tyrese Haliburton make his season debut ... as a broadcaster, that is.

Haliburton will make his debut as a player contributor on "NBA on Prime" with an appearance on "NBA Nightcap" following Tuesday night's NBA Cup quarterfinals matchups ‚Äî the first of five such appearances this season. On "NBA Nightcap," Haliburton is expected to offer commentary on his rehab and game insights for the 2025-26 season.

The postgame analysis show is in its first season, hosted by broadcaster Taylor Rooks, featuring former NBA legends Dirk Nowitzki, Dwyane Wade, Steve Nash and Udonis Haslem, discussing the evening's NBA action.

When discussing the opportunity with The Athletic, Haliburton spoke highly of the positivity of the broadcast's coverage and its ability to reach the casual fan:

"I think just being able to talk about the game with people, and not always having to be so critical of players, but just how we can talk about the game and put today‚Äôs players in the right limelight. I think it is important."

"I think that our league, arguably, is one of the only leagues where people are so critical of players that sometimes it can create opinions from the casual fan that they don‚Äôt even know what they‚Äôre talking about."

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just what they‚Äôre hearing on television. I think that Prime is doing a great job of just allowing former players to come on and celebrate our game, which I think is better just overall for everybody.‚Äù

Last season, Haliburton averaged 18.6 points, 9.2 assists and 3.5 rebounds per game. His late-game heroics in the playoffs helped lead the Pacers to beat the Milwaukee Bucks, Cleveland Cavaliers and the New York Knicks to advance to their first NBA Finals appearance since 2000.

This year, the Pacers have struggled to fill Haliburton's void as a scorer and playmaker. The Pacers are 6-18, currently 14th in the Eastern Conference, while ranking 29th in points per game and last in field goal percentage. Last season, they were seventh and third in those categories, respectively.

Pascal Siakam is the team's leading scorer this season, averaging 24.5 points, 7 rebounds and 4.1 assists. Fourth-year guard Bennedict Mathurin is also having a career campaign, averaging 21.5 points, 5.6 rebounds and 2.3 assists per game.

The Pacers have struggled to create assists without their leading playmaker, giving Andrew Nembhard and T.J. McConnell expanded playmaking roles. The Pacers are last in assists, averaging 23.5 per game. Last season, they were third in assists per game, averaging 29.2 per game.

Injuries have also taken a toll on this team, with Mathurin, Nembhard and Obi Toppin all missing a significant portion of the early season. The Pacers are currently on a two-game winning streak and play the Philadelphia 76ers on Friday.

title: What Philip Rivers signing with the Colts means for his Hall of Fame candidacy
description: Philip Rivers is considering a comeback with the Indianapolis Colts. Mark Schofield breaks down what it could mean for his Hall of Fame candidacy.
fullText:
After losing Daniel Jones for the season with an Achilles injury, the Indianapolis Colts are turning back the clock to shore up their quarterback room.

Philip Rivers, who has not played in the NFL since the 2020 season and is yes, a grandfather, is signing with the Colts after meeting with the team and working out for the coaching staff. This is a reunion of sorts on two levels. head coach Shane Steichen was a coach in the Chargers organization for years, and Rivers‚Äô final NFL season came in Indianapolis with the Colts. Rivers and the Colts advanced to the playoffs that season, bowing out in a loss to the Buffalo Bills on Wild Card Weekend.

This makes for a fascinating story, and also presents an interesting wrinkle for Hall of Fame voters.

This is his first year of eligibility for inclusion in the Pro Football Hall of Fame, and Rivers was recently named as one of 26 Modern-Era semifinalists for enshrinement in the Class of 2026. Rivers is one of three quarterbacks in the group, along with Drew Brees and Eli Manning. A five-year waiting period for eligibility remains in effect for the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

At the moment, Rivers is simply signing with the Colts‚Äô practice squad. According to a spokesperson from the Pro Football Hall of Fame, as long as he remains on the practice squad, he remains eligible to be a member of the Class of 2026.

However, if he is signed to the active roster and takes a snap, it would reset that five-year period, and the earliest he would be eligible for the Pro Football Hall of Fame is 2031, provided he does not play next year.

Per a spokesperson for the Pro Football Hall of Fame: 
If Philip Rivers signs with the #Colts and takes a snap, his HOF eligibility would reset and he would need to be out for another five seasons for Hall of Fame eligibility. 

Rivers is currently a semi-finalist for 2026.

‚Äî Clayton Holloway (@HollowayNFLN) December 9, 2025

‚ÄúIf he‚Äôs signed to the practice squad, and that‚Äôs his status with the team (and thus still eligible for Hall) for an extended period to the point that we announce the final 15, and he then goes active, he‚Äôd come off, and we‚Äôd have 14,‚Äù the spokesman said to NBC Sports.

That reference to 14 highlights another point. The next step in the Hall of Fame voting process is narrowing the group of 26 players down to 15. That vote takes place later this month.

Then at the annual Hall of Fame Selection Meeting, held early next year, the Class of 2026 will be announced.

If Rivers is still on the practice squad for the vote in December, but is subsequently signed to the active roster, it could create a situation where he makes the list of 15 players to advance to the next stage of voting, but is removed after signing to the active roster.

There does seem to be some grey areas: What if he is elevated but does not take a snap? Is he still eligible?

This is probably a scenario the Hall of Fame did not consider when putting together the requirements for eligibility.

title: One Chelsea player in Team of the Week ‚Äì  and why it‚Äôs bad news for the Blues
description: While the focus right now is on tonight‚Äôs Champions League game, there is some interesting Premier League news coming out from the weekend just gone.The WhoScored team of the week is out, and it fea...
fullText:
While the focus right now is on tonight‚Äôs Champions League game, there is some interesting Premier League news coming out from the weekend just gone.

The WhoScored team of the week is out, and it features one Blue after their 0-0 draw with Bournemouth ‚Äì goalkeeper Robert Sanchez.

The Premier League team of the week for Gameweek 15 as the season approaches the halfway mark.

As always, having the goalkeeper in the team of the week is always a bit of a backhanded compliment ‚Äì it means he played well, but you probably deserved to lose.

That was definitely the case at the Vitality on Saturday. Sanchez was excellent and bailed his team out a few times. The home team had a goal ruled out of a tight offside then had a penalty chalked off moments later for the same reason as they pushed hard.

Still, that‚Äôs not on the Spaniard. He‚Äôs in the best form of his Chelsea career, and for once he‚Äôs not the problem in this team. The increasingly stable and regular Trevoh Chalobah ‚Äì Wesley Fofana partnership ahead of him is clearly helping him, as is Enzo Maresca‚Äôs change of plan in terms of no longer always playing out from the back.

Let‚Äôs hope he‚Äôs not called into action quite as much tonight as we face Atalanta with 3 vital Champions League points on the line.

Joao Pedro wasn‚Äôt ever going to feature in this team ‚Äì he‚Äôs been in dire form of late, and an injury to one of his teammates isn‚Äôt going to help matters. His stats compared to Nicolas Jackson make ugly reading.

Chelsea‚Äôs game tonight is away in Italy, but Enzo Maresca isn‚Äôt letting playing 3 in a row away from home be an excuse for his side.

title: Bruno Fernandes joined by Man United trio in Team of the Week after big win vs. Wolves
description: Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes has been joined by two of his teammates in a team of the week selection, following the club‚Äôs 4-1 triumph over Wolverhampton Wanderers on Monday.Fernandes d...
fullText:
Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes has been joined by two of his teammates in a team of the week selection, following the club‚Äôs 4-1 triumph over Wolverhampton Wanderers on Monday.

Fernandes ran the show as United cruised past Wolves to catapult themselves into sixth place in the Premier League table.

United took the lead in the first half through Fernandes, who made the very best out of an underwhelming pass from Matheus Cunha. However, the game was level at half-time after a response from the hosts.

The Red Devils came out firing after the break and retook the advantage thanks to Bryan Mbeumo, who tapped in a Diogo Dalot cross into the back of the net after Sam Johnstone desperately came rushing out of his line.

Mason Mount made it 3-1 for United shortly after the hour mark with a close-range volley after Fernandes brilliantly found him inside the box. Fernandes‚Äô penalty kick late on completed the rout and sealed all three points at the Molineux.

A number of United players performed well but it was Fernandes who stood out head and shoulders above the rest. Beyond his goals and assist, he completely dominated the midfield, and Wolves simply had no answer for some of the sensational things he pulled off.

A true captain's performance from Bruno Fernandes against Wolves ü§å pic.twitter.com/Xk3BPO8g2W

‚Äî Premier League (@premierleague) December 9, 2025

His exploits have earned him WhoScored‚Äôs Premier League Player of the Week. He has also been named in the Team of the Week, alongside Dalot, Amad and Matheus Cunha.

üåü Premier League Player of the Week - Bruno Fernandes. #MUFC | @ManUtd pic.twitter.com/7bq5bHSNJW

‚Äî WhoScored (@WhoScored) December 9, 2025

Fernandes is the highest-rated player in the Team of the Week with a score of 9.53. He features in a midfield also consisting of Mateus Fernandes (West Ham) and Rayan Cherki (Manchester City).

WhoScored note that since joining United from Sporting CP, Fernandes is the highest-rated Premier League player (7.33) to play a minimum of 150 games.

It‚Äôs even more impressive that he continues to deliver in a largely unfamiliar deeper midfield role.

Amad and Dalot, with ratings of 7.87 and 7.95 respectively, form the full-back pairing of a back-four unit that also has Ruben Dias (Manchester City) and Michael Keane (Everton).

Premier League Team of the Week. üî•

‚Äî WhoScored (@WhoScored) December 9, 2025

United are next in action on Monday, December 15, when they welcome Bournemouth to Old Trafford.

Featured image Shaun Botterill via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: PSA to open London receiving center in 2026
description: UK collectors will be able to submit items for grading without hassles of customs
fullText:
PSA's international expansion will take another step forward when the grading giant opens a receiving center in the London area in the second half of 2026.

Although no firm date was included with Tuesday‚Äôs announcement, PSA said the new facility will serve collectors in the United Kingdom by eliminating issues and delays with customs, lowering shipping fees and providing prices in local currency.

PSA "expects to hire approximately 20‚Äù new UK employees across operations, customer service and marketing as part of the expansion, the company said.

When the new facility is operational, UK collectors will be able to submit items using ‚Äústandard domestic postage,‚Äù and graded items will be returned to the UK receiving center for final delivery.

The company said it would announce more details, including a target launch date, next year.

PSA opened a London receiving center inside Fanatics‚Äô flagship hobby store on Regent Street earlier this spring.

In September, PSA announced it would open a full-scale grading facility in Frankfurt, Germany, its first in Europe.

title: Liverpool man charged with racially abusing Antoine Semenyo during match at Anfield
description: Mark Mogan has been charged with Racially Aggravated Section 5 Public Order against the Bournemouth forward
fullText:
A man has been charged with racially abusing footballer Antoine Semenyo during a Premier League match.

Mark Mogan, 47, from Liverpool, has been charged with a racially aggravated section 5 public order offence against the Bournemouth forward.

The incident is alleged to have happened during the Liverpool v Bournemouth fixture on 15 August, Merseyside Police said.

Mogan, of Templehill Close, Dovecot, has been conditionally bailed and will appear at Liverpool Magistrates‚Äô Court on 22 December.

Merseyside Police said in a statement: ‚ÄúWe can confirm that a Liverpool man has been charged in connection with an incident during a Liverpool FC match at Anfield in August.‚Äù

Semenyo reported being racially abused by a spectator during the first Premier League game of the season.

Match referee Anthony Taylor stopped play in the 29th minute and a man was ejected from the Anfield stadium.

Semenyo, 25, scored twice in the second half to help bring Bournemouth back from two goals down at Anfield before Liverpool went on to eventually win 4-2.

A spokesperson for Liverpool Football Club said in August that it was aware of the allegation of racist abuse and that ‚Äúwe condemn racism and discrimination in all forms, it has no place in society, or football‚Äù.

The Football Association said it was ‚Äúconcerned‚Äù about the allegation of racism towards Semenyo and that it would ensure ‚Äúappropriate action‚Äù would be taken.

title: MK Dons defender Sanders banned for three matches
description: MK Dons defender Jack Sanders is given a three-match ban for violent conduct during Saturday's FA Cup win over Oldham.
fullText:
MK Dons defender Jack Sanders has been banned for three matches for violent conduct during Saturday's FA Cup second-round victory against Oldham Athletic.

The incident happened as the Dons took the lead in the 42nd minute through Joe Tomlinson's fine volley.

Centre-back Sanders appeared to tangle with Latics defender Dynel Simeu as the ball was crossed into the box in the build up the the goal.

In a statement, the FA said "the player's behaviour around the 42nd minute wasn't seen by the match officials at the time, but was caught on video and it was alleged subsequently that this constitutes violent conduct".

Sanders, who was taken off at half-time, denied the charge but an independent regulatory commission found it to be proven and imposed the suspension.

MK Dons beat Oldham 3-1 and will play Championship side Oxford United in the third round of the FA Cup in January.

title: Next 2 weeks will tell us a lot about the 2025 Packers' path forward
description: Matchups against the Broncos and Bears over the next two weeks will help determine the path -- and possibly show how far they can go -- for the 2025 Packers.
fullText:
Internally, the Green Bay Packers are finishing up corrections from Sunday's win at Lambeau Field and then setting their sights on this week's trip to Denver to play the 11-2 Broncos at Empower Field at Mile High. It's the only way to operate in the NFL. Looking ahead gets punished.

For us on the outside, however, it's safe to look ahead and wonder. And it's probably fair to look at the next two games -- both on the road, against the Broncos and Chicago Bears -- and see what could be revealed about Matt LaFleur's team and the path ahead.

The Packers are 9-3-1, in first place in the NFC North and in possession of the No. 2 seed in the NFC. Per The Athletic's NFL Playoff Simulator, the Packers have a 95 percent chance of making the postseason. They are in an excellent spot with four games to go. This appears to be a team getting hot at the right time.

But this is no longer about just getting to the postseason, an important step in the process but a feat the Packers have accomplished in each of the last two years. It's time for more. And setting the path forward can make or break a playoff run.

The Packers were 9-3 in December of last season. But losses in the team's two biggest remaining games, at Detroit and at Minnesota, crushed any chances of hosting a playoff game and had the Packers limping into the postseason.

There's a chance to write a different story in 2025.

The Broncos might be an uncommon AFC foe, but Sean Payton's team is a legitimate Super Bowl contender, and winning in Denver -- where the Broncos are 6-0 this season -- will be no easy task. The Broncos are terrific along the offensive line and have one of the most disruptive defensive lines in football. You want to win big in the postseason? You better be able to stand tall and win the line of scrimmage. The Packers will get a big opportunity to prove they are championship caliber up front on both sides of the ball in Denver.

And every win is going to matter. Lose to the Broncos and hopes of securing the No. 1 seed in the NFC diminish greatly. Lose and the final three games suddenly get a little more stressful. Win in Denver and get to 10-3-1, and suddenly a 13-3-1 finish looks entirely possible.

In two weeks, the rematch in Chicago arrives. You want to win the division for the first time since 2021 and host a home playoff game? You want to be the No. 1 or No. 2 seed in the conference? Well, you better go to Chicago and finish the sweep of the Bears.

The Packers held on to beat Ben Johnson's team on Sunday, but it was a 60-minute fight. Chicago drew the game even in the fourth quarter and had a real chance to tie it again late. They are tough and talented. In primetime, in what will almost certainly be terrible weather in Chicago in mid-December, the Packers must once again vanquish the upstart rivals. It won't be easy. But it is necessary.

In 1996, the Packers won five straight games after an 8-3 start, including wins over the Bears and Broncos to open December. The run positioned Mike Holmgren's team as the No. 1 seed, ensured a first-round bye and guaranteed that any NFC title game would be played at Lambeau Field.

The 2025 Packers have a similar opportunity.

Four straight wins, including three consecutive over division rivals, put the Packers in this position. The season hit a slippery spot after Tucker Kraft went down, but LaFleur's team has successfully countered steered. All great teams eventually face these moments. The Packers appears to have survived theirs.

Now, it's time to be forged in the crucible of really important December football games.

Packers-Broncos. Packers-Bears, again. Outdoors. Big stakes. Everyone watching. These are the games where champions form the unshakeable confidence necessary for winning in January and February.

This article originally appeared on Packers Wire: Next 2 weeks will tell us a lot about the 2025 Packers' path forward

title: Knicks vs Raptors Prediction, Picks & Odds for Tonight‚Äôs NBA Cup Quarterfinal Game
description: Bet on Scottie Barnes from beyond the arc in our Knicks vs. Raptors picks, odds & expert predictions for the NBA Cup Quarterfinals on Tuesday, December 9.
fullText:
The Toronto Raptors were roaring when they earned one of the top seeds in the NBA Cup, but then RJ Barrett got hurt, and suddenly the Raptors looked toothless.

But they‚Äôll need to find some bite from beyond the arc if they want to move on to the semifinals against a New York Knicks team that‚Äôs playing some great basketball.

My Knicks vs. Raptors predictions break down this NBA Cup quarterfinals matchup with my best NBA picks.

Knicks vs Raptors best bet: Scottie Barnes Over 1.5 threes (+140)

It‚Äôs pretty clear at this point what RJ Barrett has meant to the Toronto Raptors this season.

Toronto was in a groove with a 12-5 record before Barrett hurt his knee in a November 23 meeting with the Brooklyn Nets. Since them, the Raptors are just 3-5 straight up and 1-7 against the spread, including 1-5 SU and 0-6 ATS in their last six overall.

Meanwhile, the New York Knicks are starting to play their best basketball of the season. They are 7-1 SU/ATS in their last eight overall, which includes a 116-94 win over the Raps at Madison Square Garden back on November 30.

However, the Knicks are an interesting team. They basically live and die by the three-ball. New York attempts the sixth-most threes per game with the fifth-highest shooting percentage while at the same time allowing opponents to take the fourth-most threes per game and ranking 19th in opponent three-point shooting percentage.

Now, with the way these teams are trending, I lean toward the Knicks covering this spread, but one of the Raptors' strengths is defending the perimeter (third-best opponent three-point shooting perentage), and are a better team at home, so I hesitate a little there.

But someone without hesitation for the Raptors this season is Scottie Barnes. The former Rookie of the Year is having a great season, averaging 20 points, 8.0 rebounds and 5.3 assists per game. He is also shooting the ball better than ever before, draining a career-high 39.8% of his threes.

He‚Äôs shooting 40% from beyond the arc over his last five games, hitting two or more three times. That includes going 4-for-7 from deep in that November 30 meeting against the Knicks.

The Raptors know if they want to pull off the upset in this NBA Cup quarterfinal, they‚Äôll have to hit some threes, so there is a ton of value for Barnes to nail a few more on Tuesday night.

While it didn‚Äôt quite make best bet status, I‚Äôll happily add Knicks -4.5 to this SGP. Not only does it not create the negative correlation we love for these SGPs, but New York is just playing very well right now.

The Knicks have won seven of their last eight games with a net rating that only trails the Oklahoma City Thunder during that stretch. With the Raptors still struggling to find consistency without RJ Barrett, it‚Äôs hard to back them when it comes to covering this number in this spot.

And it‚Äôs the Raptors' offense that has really struggled in Barrett‚Äôs absence. They rank next-to-last in offensive rating since Barrett got hurt, and the Under is 6-3 in those nine games without him. That includes the most recent matchup with the Knicks.

OG Anunoby returns to Toronto with a bang. In his second game back from injury he went 5-for-7 from three and you know he's comfortable in Scotiabank Arena.

Spread: Knicks -4.5 | Raptors +4.5

Moneyline: Knicks -190 | Raptors +165

Over/Under: Over 226.5 | Under 226.5

The Raptors are 0-7 against the spread in their last seven games in a row. All without RJ Barrett, who will be out once again Tuesday night. Find more¬†NBA betting trends for Knicks vs. Raptors.

title: Zach Wilson's 4-star QB brother enters transfer portal after HS offers from Miami, Oregon
description: Keep an eye on Isaac Wilson.
fullText:
Zach Wilson's 4-star QB brother enters transfer portal after HS offers from Miami, Oregon originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

A quarterback with an impressive pedigree has entered into the transfer portal.

And two of the biggest-name programs that offered him in high school, Miami and Oregon, could be looking for a QB.

There's no guarantee that Dante Moore leaves the Ducks for the NFL, but it seems likely. And the Hurricanes are looking at a future past Carson Beck.

Will they want Isaac Wilson this time around? It's hard to say. But he'll be available.

Wilson is the younger brother of former BYU star and No. 2 overall NFL Draft pick Zach Wilson.

Isaac Wilson is transferring from Utah, according to On3's Hayes Fawcett. He has three years of eligibility remaining.

MORE:¬†Texas Tech commit breaks 72-year old TX HS football rushing record

Wilson was a four-star recruit out of Corner Canyon High School in Utah.

He had offers from Arizona, Arizona State, BYU, Louisville, Miami, Michigan, Oklahoma State, Oregon, Oregon State, San Diego State and Washington State.

For the Utes, Wilson played in nine games as a freshman in 2024. He threw for 1,510 yards on a 56.4% completion rate, tossing 10 touchdowns and 11 interceptions.

This season, Wilson got into just one game and threw one incompletion.

His performance as a freshman wasn't great, but it showed enough flashes and put enough film out there that teams should have solid information to go on as long as they aren't concerned about his lack of playing time this season behind star QB Devon Dampier.

Keep an eye on Wilson. He may not be the best QB available, but he'll have some past connections to draw upon.

MORE:¬†Georgia player who previously medically retired is now in the transfer portal

title: Inter vs Liverpool ‚Äì Ince says ‚Äòbattle will be won in midfield‚Äô
description: Paul Ince knows better than most what it means when Inter meet Liverpool.The former England midfielder, who spent two seasons in Milan before joining the Reds, admits the fixture ‚Äútests his emotions...
fullText:
Paul Ince knows better than most what it means when Inter meet Liverpool.

The former England midfielder, who spent two seasons in Milan before joining the Reds, admits the fixture ‚Äútests his emotions‚Äù even now.

Speaking ahead of the Champions League showdown, the ex-Inter ‚ÄúGovernatore‚Äù underlined the unique connection he still feels with both clubs and why this edition of the match-up will come down to control of the midfield.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a very special game, it really pushes my emotions,‚Äù Ince said to La Gazzetta dello Sport.

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì DECEMBER 06: Hakan Calhanoglu of FC Internazionale Milano celebrates scoring his team‚Äôs third goal during the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and Como 1907 at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on December 06, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

‚ÄúNot many players can say they‚Äôve played for both Liverpool and Inter, two giant clubs. I‚Äôm lucky I did. When people ask who I support, I always say I hope nobody wins, a draw would be perfect.‚Äù

Ince believes Cristian Chivu‚Äôs side approach the tie in the right moment, but warned against assuming Liverpool‚Äôs recent chaos makes them harmless. ‚ÄúThe reaction after the derby defeat was immediate,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe team is ready to explode. But don‚Äôt think Liverpool are easy just because of the mess they‚Äôre in.‚Äù

LEEDS, ENGLAND ‚Äì DECEMBER 06: Virgil van Dijk of Liverpool reacts during the Premier League match between Leeds United and Liverpool at Elland Road on December 06, 2025 in Leeds, England. (Photo by Alex Livesey/Getty Images)

The retired midfielder was particularly candid about the Premier League side‚Äôs structural issues. ‚ÄúLiverpool are a strange team, they can score loads and concede loads,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no settled formation. One week a player starts, the next he‚Äôs on the bench or out of position. That creates confusion. Inter will definitely have chances, but they have to take them.‚Äù

Ultimately, Ince expects the match to hinge on the midfield. ‚ÄúThe battle will be won there,‚Äù he insisted. ‚ÄúInter have Calhanoglu for control and Barella with passion and quality. Liverpool have great midfielders too. But whoever takes hold of the middle of the pitch will win the game.‚Äù

Follow all the action from the game, as it happens, on our Liveblog.

title: Gerard Pique confident Barcelona can win Champions League with Hansi Flick
description: The former defender has shared his thoughts.
fullText:
Barcelona‚Äôs hopes of winning the 2026 Champions League have been played down this season, with many commentators claiming Hansi Flick‚Äôs high line will cost them in Europe.

However, Gerard Pique has a very different opinion and thinks the Catalan giants can go on and win the lot in the current campaign.

‚ÄúI think there has been much more noise than what is really happening on the pitch. They are in line with what we saw last year.¬†A very offensive team, taking a lot of risks, but at the same time putting on a lot of show, which in the end is what the people want, scoring a lot of goals and also fitting in as is evident with Flick‚Äôs approach. I think they are a candidate for everything,‚Äù he told Sport.

‚ÄúAlso in Europe? Yes, why not? It is clear that in Europe right now there are very powerful projects¬†and that it looks like sooner rather than later they will end up winning the Champions League. Arsenal, for example, or PSG, who already won it last year. Add to that Real Madrid or Bayern, who with Kompany I think have raised the level, so well, obviously it will be complicated.‚Äù

Barcelona are back in Champions League action on Tuesday against Eintracht Frankfurt and really need to win to keep their hopes of automatic qualification to the next round alive.

title: Petr Yan boots Merab from Top 5 at pound-for-pound in official UFC 323 rankings update
description: UFC 323 caused a major shakeup in the official UFC rankings, thanks to title-winning performances from Petr Yan and Joshua Van. The action went down last Sat. night (Dec. 6, 2025) at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas and marked the end of the promotion‚Äôs pay-per-view (PPV) era. As well as the end of title reigns [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
UFC 323 caused a major shakeup in the official UFC rankings, thanks to title-winning performances from Petr Yan and Joshua Van. The action went down last Sat. night (Dec. 6, 2025) at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas and marked the end of the promotion‚Äôs pay-per-view (PPV) era.

As well as the end of title reigns for Merab Dvalishvili and Alexandre Pantoja.

A handful of fighters also made their debuts on the latest rankings chart, including bantamweight phenom Payton Talbott. The 27 year-old ‚ÄúContender Series‚Äù standout landed at No. 12 on the bantamweight ladder after retiring former 135-pound champion Henry Cejudo.

Here‚Äôs how the rankings are compiled, at least until AI takes over:

Rankings are generated by a voting panel made up of media members. The media members were asked to vote for who they feel are the top fighters in the UFC by weight-class and pound-for-pound. A fighter is only eligible to be voted on if they are in active status in the UFC. A fighter can appear in more than one weight division at a time. The champion and interim champion are considered to be in the top positions of their respective divisions and therefore are not eligible for voting by weight-class. However, the champions can be voted on for the pound-for-pound rankings.

Take a look at what the latest rankings field looks like courtesy of UFC.com. Note: (+/- = movement in rankings, T = tie, *NR = Not previously ranked).

1. Islam Makhachev
2. Ilia Topuria
3. Khamzat Chimaev +1
4. Alex Pereira +2

title: Tower Motorsports adds Kyffin Simpson to Daytona 24 roster
description: Kyffin Simpson will drive for Tower Motorsports in next month‚Äôs Rolex 24 at Daytona, the team confirmed via social media on Tuesday
fullText:
Kyffin Simpson will drive for Tower Motorsports in next month‚Äôs Rolex 24 at Daytona, the team confirmed via social media on Tuesday.

The 21-year-old Simpson, who is fresh off contesting a promising second season in the IndyCar Series with Chip Ganassi Racing that included a maiden podium on the Streets of Toronto, completes an LMP2 lineup in Tower‚Äôs No. 8 Oreca 07 Gibson that includes the full-time pairing of John Farano and Sebastien Bourdais, along with endurance add-on Sebastian Alvarez.

Proud to confirm our full ‚Äô26 driver lineup: S√©bastien Bourdais & Sebastian Alvarez are back for another season, with Kyffin Simpson rejoining us for Daytona.

Having all three back speaks to the foundation we‚Äôve built, & we‚Äôre carrying that momentum straight into the Rolex 24! pic.twitter.com/mzuE0aK8kG

‚Äî TOWER MOTORSPORTS (@TOWERMTSPRTS8) December 9, 2025

This will mark a reunion for Simpson, who previously raced with Tower for the endurance rounds in 2023 and 2024, taking a class win in the Twelve Hours of Sebring in the latter year with Farano and IndyCar star Scott McLaughlin.

Additionally, he won the European Le Mans Championship in Algarve Pro Racing‚Äôs LMP2 machine in 2023, teaming alongside Alex Lynn and James Allen to capture two wins and five podiums in six races.

Simpson, the 2021 Formula Regional Americas champion, last competed in IMSA‚Äôs crown jewel event in 2024 with DragonSpeed, finishing seventh in class and 48th overall.

Sting Ray Robb to continue with Juncos Racing for 2026 IndyCar season

Former Indy 500 winner Marcus Ericsson added to WTR Daytona 24 lineup

Mick Schumacher hails IndyCar racing as "the way it should be" after F1

title: Meet 6-foot-3 powerhouse on the verge of clinching an LPGA card
description: Germany's Helen Briem, 20, boasts an average swing speed of 105 mph.
fullText:
Last year at LPGA Q-School, the petite Miyu Yamashita dominated the proceedings. Standing just under 5 feet tall, Yamashita trounced the field by six shots in Mobile, Alabama, and then proceeded to win a major championship this season en route to clinching the Louise Suggs LPGA Rookie of the Year title.

This year at RTJ's Magnolia Grove, 6-foot-3 Helen Briem is making a statement at LPGA Final Qualifying. The 20-year-old from Germany who boasts an average swing speed of 105 mph enters the final day of play in a share of second.

This year's 90-hole event was shortened to 72 holes ‚Äì with no cut ‚Äì due to weather. Players came back to finish Round 3 on Monday morning, and then began the fourth round later that afternoon. Play is scheduled to conclude on Tuesday, with the top 25 and ties earning LPGA cards for 2026.

The statuesque Briem is used to attention.

In 2023, the long-hitting Briem made history when she became the first German to win the R&A's Girls' Amateur in the event's 104-year history by a record 12-and-10 margin. At the 2022 Women's World Amateur Team Championship, Briem took a share of medalist honors at Le Golf National in Paris with Rose Zhang and Meja Ortengren, though no official title or medal was given for individual results.

Last year, while still an amateur, Briem tied for 11th at the Amundi German Masters and finished runner-up at the Dormy Open Helsingborg to Perrine Delacour on the LET. She then rattled off three consecutive victories on the LET Access Series, a developmental tour. After winning the European Ladies' Team Championship in July, she became the first German to rise to No. 1 in the World Amateur Golf Ranking. Only she didn't stay there very long, choosing to immediately turn professional.

Briem won her first Ladies European Tour event, the 2024 La Sella Open, in her first start on the LET as a professional. In 2025, Briem had six top-5 finishes on that tour, including three runner-ups.

Currently No. 84 in the world, Briem came over to the U.S. straight from Spain following the LET's season-ender. After posting rounds of 65-69-71, she is currently 10 under for the tournament, one stroke behind China's Jin Yang. She has 11 holes left to play.

This article originally appeared on Golfweek: Meet the 6-foot-3 powerhouse on the verge of clinching an LPGA card

title: Champions League Liveblog: Inter-Liverpool and Atalanta-Chelsea
description: This page will update live with the latest relevant news, no need to refresh the page!Join us for all the build-up and action as it happens from tonight‚Äôs Champions League games with an Anglo-Italia...
fullText:
This page will update live with the latest relevant news, no need to refresh the page!

Join us for all the build-up and action as it happens from tonight‚Äôs Champions League games with an Anglo-Italian theme, as Inter host Liverpool and Atalanta welcome Enzo Maresca‚Äôs Chelsea.

They both kick off at 20.00 GMT.

Inter had won the first four European ties until their last-gasp 2-1 defeat to Atletico Madrid and they take on a Liverpool side in crisis.

Atalanta are still adapting to new coach Raffaele Palladino, but are doing very well in the Champions League as Maresca brings Chelsea to Bergamo.

title: Inter Miami's Lionel Messi becomes MLS' first repeat MVP
description: Lionel Messi set yet another record in a soccer career already jammed with groundbreaking achievements, becoming the first repeat MLS MVP winner.
fullText:
Dec. 9 (UPI) -- Lionel Messi set yet another record in a soccer career already jammed with groundbreaking achievements, becoming the first repeat MLS MVP winner.

The eight-time Ballon d'Or winner received the award for his 2025 exploits at a ceremony Tuesday at Chase Stadium in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., three days after he led the Herons to their first MLS Cup.

"We've had a lot of world-class players in our league, but there is only one Leo Messi," MLS commissioner Don Garber told reporters.

Messi, 38, led MLS with 29 goals and 19 assists over 28 matches. His 48 contributions during the regular season were the second most in league history, trailing only Carlos Vela's 49 from 2019. Messi also registered at least three goal contributions in nine consecutive matches and recorded 10 multi-goal games.

The Argentine forward won 70.4% of the vote to win his second Landon Donovan MLS MVP Award. Anders Dreyer of San Diego FC finished second, ahead of LAFC's Denis Bouanga, FC Cincinnati's Evander and Nashville SC's Sam Surridge.

Messi is the second player in MLS history to win multiple MVPs, joining Kansas City Wizards legend Preki, who won in 1997 and 2003.

The longtime former Barcelona star provided two assists in the Herons' 3-1 win over the Vancouver Whitecaps in the 2025 MLS Cup finale Saturday in Fort Lauderdale, en route to MLS Cup MVP honors.

He set an MLS playoff record with 15 goal contributions -- from six goals and nine assists. Messi is under contract through 2028 with the Herons, who plan to open a new stadium next year.

title: Outsiders Bod√∏/Glimt overcome the odds on Champions League adventure
description: With due respect for the difficult task ahead in Dortmund, Fredrik Sj√∏vold is full of excitement: ‚ÄúIt will be a great experience to play here. We are looking forward to it and are very excited,‚Äù ...
fullText:
With due respect for the difficult task ahead in Dortmund, Fredrik Sj√∏vold is full of excitement: ‚ÄúIt will be a great experience to play here. We are looking forward to it and are very excited,‚Äù says the midfielder. The unusually large crowd by Norwegian standards is more of an incentive than a burden for him: ‚ÄúWe will try to play our game. No matter how many fans there are.‚Äù

Coach Kjetil Knutsen is approaching the match against the sixth-placed team with a similarly positive attitude: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had a long journey and have earned our stripes by qualifying for the Champions League. That‚Äôs why every game means a lot to us.‚Äù BVB would be well advised to prepare for a strong and highly motivated team. ‚ÄúIf we want to be competitive, we have to run a lot. Otherwise, we don‚Äôt stand a chance against the best teams,‚Äù says Knutsen.

The coach attested to BVB‚Äôs ‚Äútop-top quality‚Äù: ‚ÄúWe have spent a lot of time figuring out how to counter Dortmund‚Äôs individual quality and compact shape. On Wednesday, we‚Äôll see if we can keep up at this level.‚Äù He had special praise for Dortmund full-back and compatriot Julian Ryerson: ‚ÄúHe has a big heart and is a great player who inspires us. He‚Äôll be very motivated.‚Äù

After five games with only two points, Bod√∏/Glimt are in 32nd place. A defeat in Dortmund would make their chances of progressing very slight, as they still have a home game against Manchester City and a trip to Atl√©tico Madrid to come. Nevertheless, with their first-ever participation in the Champions League group stage, a football fairy tale has come true for the team from northern Norway. They had previously failed three times in the qualifiers. Ever since their spectacular quarter-final victory over Lazio in last season's Europa League, which saw a Norwegian club reach the semi-finals of a European competition for the first time, the innovative club have enjoyed a stellar reputation far beyond their country‚Äôs borders.

FK Bod√∏/Glimt, who were threatened with insolvency in 2010, have experienced a miraculous rise after being relegated from Norway‚Äôs top tier at the end of the 2016 season. Accompanied by a fundamental change in mentality and changes at the management level, the club managed to bounce back immediately. Four championship titles in 2020, 2021, 2023 and 2024 were the reward for the club‚Äôs courageous decision to focus more on young, local talent. Eight players from the current squad come from the club‚Äôs own academy. The best-known player in Germany is probably striker Jens Petter Hauge, who played for Eintracht Frankfurt between 2021 and 2025 and previously for AC Milan, but whose participation on Wednesday is doubtful due to illness.

Given the positive overall development, it is not too painful that this year‚Äôs championship title went to their rivals from Stavanger, who were just one point ahead, a few days ago. Coach Knutsen is considered the architect of this success. Since taking office in January 2018, the 57-year-old football coach has focused on a modern, offensive style of play with intense pressing and a high willingness to run. In addition, mental coach Bj√∏rn Mannsverk, a former fighter jet pilot, reinforces the team‚Äôs confident and passionate attitude.

Although Bod√∏/Glimt have gone without a win in their five Champions League matches to date, against Slavia Prague (2-2), Tottenham Hotspur (2-2), Galatasaray (a 3-1 loss), Monaco (a 1-0 loss) and Juventus (a 3-2 loss), they have delivered all-round respectable performances in their debut season. This is attested by the statistics: they've had 57% possession and 86% pass accuracy. That is why Nico Kovac warns against underestimating the Norwegians: ‚ÄúThey haven‚Äôt picked up enough points, but have always been close‚Äù (Preview.).

Bod√∏/Glimt are making their 12th appearance in a European club competition (facts). In their only previous encounter with a German opponent, the club lost 5-0 (H) and 1-1 (A) to Werder Bremen in the first round of the UEFA Cup in 1999/2000. BVB coach Kovac makes no secret of his respect for the upward trend in northern Europe: ‚ÄúNorwegian football has developed tremendously in recent years. What is happening there is really great and a showcase project for many others.‚Äù
